 1	// waitForElementTransition by markcellus
 2	// https://github.com/markcellus/wait-for-element-transition
 3	
 4	// Downloaded version of to resolve issue with dead repository
 5	
 6	interface CssPropUnitMap {
 7	 num?: number;
 8	 unit: string;
 9	}
 10	
 11	/**
 12	 * Takes a value and separates the number and unit into a key/value map.
 13	 */
 14	const getCssPropUnitMap = (v: string): CssPropUnitMap => {
 15	 v = v.trim();
 16	 const numParts = v.match('[0-9.]+');
 17	 let unit = 'ms';
 18	 let num;
 19	 const numString: string = numParts ? numParts[0] : '';
 20	 if (numString) {
 21	 unit = v.split(numString)[1];
 22	 num = Number(numString);
 23	 }
 24	 return {
 25	 num,
 26	 unit,
 27	 };
 28	};
 29	
 30	/**
 31	 * Converts a css timing unit value into milliseconds.
 32	 */
 33	const convertCssTimeValueToMilliseconds = (val: string): string => {
 34	 const map = getCssPropUnitMap(val);
 35	 const num = map ? map.num : undefined;
 36	 if (!num) {
 37	 return '';
 38	 }
 39	 const unit = val.replace(num + '', '');
 40	 let value = num;
 41	 if (unit === 's') {
 42	 value = num * 1000;
 43	 }
 44	 return value + 'ms';
 45	};
 46	
 47	/**
 48	 * Gets the time is takes for the element to transition to its show state.
 49	 */
 50	function getTransitionDuration(el: HTMLElement): number {
 51	 /**
 52	 * Takes a css property name and returns the javascript version of it.
 53	 */
 54	 const getJsPropName = (cssProp: string): keyof CSSStyleDeclaration => {
 55	 // convert to camelCase
 56	 return cssProp.replace(/-([a-z])/g, (letter) => {
 57	 return letter[1].toUpperCase();
 58	 }) as keyof CSSStyleDeclaration;
 59	 };
 60	
 61	 /**
 62	 * Gets the computed property of the element.
 63	 */
 64	 const getCssComputedProperty = (prop: string): string => {
 65	 const style = window.getComputedStyle(el);
 66	 return (
 67	 style.getPropertyValue(prop) ||
 68	 (el.style[getJsPropName(prop)] as string)
 69	 );
 70	 };
 71	
 72	 const delayProp = getCssComputedProperty('transition-delay') || '0ms';
 73	 const durationProp = getCssComputedProperty('transition-duration') || '0ms';
 74	 const times = Array.isArray(durationProp) ? durationProp : [durationProp];
 75	 const delay = Array.isArray(delayProp) ? delayProp : [delayProp];
 76	 let highest = 0;
 77	 let map;
 78	
 79	 times.push.apply(times, delay); // account for delay
 80	
 81	 // calculate highest number of time
 82	 times.forEach((value) => {
 83	 value.split(',').forEach((v: string) => {
 84	 v = convertCssTimeValueToMilliseconds(v);
 85	 map = getCssPropUnitMap(v);
 86	 if (map.num && map.num > highest) {
 87	 highest = map.num;
 88	 }
 89	 });
 90	 });
 91	
 92	 return highest;
 93	}
 94	
 95	/**
 96	 * Builds a transition promise that waits to resolve until the module el's CSS transition is completed (if applicable).
 97	 */
 98	export function waitForElementTransition(
 99	 el: HTMLElement
 100	): Promise<HTMLElement> {
 101	 const duration = getTransitionDuration(el);
 102	 return new Promise((resolve) => {
 103	 if (duration > 0) {
 104	 setTimeout(() => {
 105	 resolve(el);
 106	 }, duration);
 107	 } else {
 108	 resolve(el);
 109	 }
 110	 });
 111	}

 1	<script lang="ts">
 2	
 3	 import { onMount } from "svelte";
 4	 import { waitForElementTransition } from '$lib/wait-for-element-transition';
 5	 import { imgPromises, loaderAnimationResolve } from "$lib/store";
 6	 import { dataState } from "$lib/state.svelte";
 7	
 8	 let loader: HTMLElement = $state()!;
 9	 let loadingDone = $state(false);
 10	 let loadingPercentage = $state(0);
 11	
 12	 onMount(async () => {
 13	
 14	 let counter = 0;
 15	 let length = $imgPromises.length;
 16	
 17	 // Wait for work item loading from JSON file to complete
 18	 await dataState.workData;
 19	
 20	 // Calculate percentage by how many images have loaded
 21	 $imgPromises.forEach(async (promise) => {
 22	 await promise;
 23	 counter++;
 24	 loadingPercentage = Math.round((counter / length) * 100);
 25	
 26	 // If loading is complete, initiate outro animation
 27	 if (loadingPercentage > 99) {
 28	 waitForElementTransition(loader).then(() => {
 29	 loadingDone = true;
 30	 loadingPercentage = 0;
 31	
 32	 // Once outro animation is complete, resolve page loading promise, allowing intro animations to begin
 33	 waitForElementTransition(loader).then(() => {
 34	 loaderAnimationResolve();
 35	 });
 36	 });
 37	 }
 38	 });
 39	 });
 40	
 41	</script>
 42	
 43

 45	 <div class="loader-wrapper">
 46	 <div

 48	 class:outro={loadingDone}></div>

 51	 class="loader"
 52	 class:outro={loadingDone}
 53	 style="width: {loadingPercentage}%"></div>

 1	<script lang="ts">
 2	
 3		import { loadPagePromise } from "$lib/store";
 4		import { workScrollState, viewPortState } from "$lib/state.svelte";
 5	
 6		// Svelte class toggles for hover-container
 7		let hover: boolean = $state(false);
 8		let introDisabled: boolean = $state(true);
 9	
 10		let currentPosition = {
 11			x: 0, y: 0
 12		};
 13		let targetPosition = {
 14			x: 0, y: 0
 15		};
 16	
 17		// onMouseMove, set current mouse coords and detect if any clickable is hovered
 18		function updateMouseCoords(e: MouseEvent) {
 19			// Don't do anything if its a touch mobile device
 20			if (viewPortState.isMobile) return;
 21	
 22			if (introDisabled) setTimeout(() => introDisabled = false, 200);
 23	
 24			let cursor = window.getComputedStyle((e as any).target)["cursor"];
 25			hover = (cursor === "pointer");
 26	
 27			// Clickable transition if mouse changes to pointer
 28			if (cursor === "pointer") {
 29	
 30				let currentlyHovering: Element = document.elementFromPoint(e.clientX, e.clientY)!;
 31				
 32				let width = currentlyHovering.clientWidth;
 33				let height = currentlyHovering.clientHeight;
 34				
 35				let clickableMid = {
 36					x: (currentlyHovering.getBoundingClientRect().left + (width / 2)),
 37					y: (currentlyHovering.getBoundingClientRect().top + (height / 2))
 38				}
 39	
 40				targetPosition = {
 41					x: clickableMid.x + ((clickableMid.x - e.clientX)*0.15),
 42					y: clickableMid.y + ((clickableMid.y - e.clientY)*0.15)
 43				}
 44	
 45			// Otherwise, follow the cursor
 46			} else {
 47				targetPosition = {
 48					x: e.clientX,
 49					y: e.clientY
 50				}
 51			}
 52		}
 53	
 54	
 55		// Animation loop for easing
 56		function animate(node: HTMLElement) {
 57			let t = 0.4;
 58	
 59			currentPosition.x += easeInOutQuad(t) * (targetPosition.x - currentPosition.x);
 60			currentPosition.y += easeInOutQuad(t) * (targetPosition.y - currentPosition.y);
 61			
 62			// Fix js's weird rounding errors
 63			currentPosition.x = Math.ceil(currentPosition.x * 100) / 100;
 64			currentPosition.y = Math.ceil(currentPosition.y * 100) / 100;
 65	
 66			node.style.transform = `translate3d(${currentPosition.x}px, ${currentPosition.y}px, 0px)`;
 67	
 68			requestAnimationFrame(() => animate(node));
 69		}
 70	
 71		// Easing function
 72		function easeInOutQuad(t: number) {
 73			return t < .5 ? 2 * t * t : -1 + (4 - 2 * t) * t;
 74		}
 75	
 76	
 77	</script>
 78	
 79	
 80	
 81	<svelte:body onmousemove={(e) => updateMouseCoords(e)}/>
 82	
 83	{#await loadPagePromise then _}
 84		<div class="dot-container active"
 85			class:hover
 86			class:disabled={ introDisabled || workScrollState.active }
 87			use:animate>
 88			<div class="dot"></div>
 89		</div>
 90	{/await}
 91

 1	<script lang="ts">
 2	
 3		import { animate } from "animejs";

 5		import { maskSlideIn } from "$lib/animations";
 6		import { browser } from "$app/environment";

 8		interface Props {
 9			// Scroll container to allow scrolling when anchors are clicked
 10			scrollContainer: HTMLElement;

 13		let { scrollContainer }: Props = $props();
 14	
 15		let mobileMenuActive: boolean = $state(false);
 16		let isMobileMenuAllowed: boolean = $state(browser ? window.innerWidth <= 950 : false);
 17	
 18		let mobileTransitionSwitcher = 
 19			$derived(mobileMenuActive ? 
 20			maskSlideIn : 
 21			(node: HTMLElement, _: any) => { 
 22				let out = maskSlideIn(node, {reverse: true, duration: 3000}); 
 23				return { 
 24					tick: (t: number) => {
 25						let reversedT = 1 - t;
 26						out.tick(reversedT);
 27						// Reset animation once all animations are done so desktop nav bar doesn't break
 28						if (t == 1) setTimeout(() => out.tick(1), 500);
 29					} 
 30				}
 31			});

 38			});

 1	<script lang="ts">
 2	
 3	 import { onMount } from "svelte";
 4	 import { letterSlideIn, maskSlideIn } from "$lib/animations";
 5	 import { loadPagePromise } from "$lib/store";
 6	 import { onScrolledIntoView } from "$lib/utils";
 7	 import { dataState } from "$lib/state.svelte";
 8	
 9	 let footerContainerElement: HTMLElement = $state()!
 10	 let logoElement: HTMLElement = $state()!; 
 11	 let creditsElement: HTMLElement = $state()!; 
 12	 let statusElement: HTMLElement = $state()!; 
 13	 let fullEmailLinkElement: HTMLElement = $state()!;
 14	
 15	 let signaturePath1: SVGPathElement = $state()!; 
 16	 let signaturePath2: SVGPathElement = $state()!; 
 17	 let signaturePath3: SVGPathElement = $state()!;
 18	 let signaturePath4: SVGPathElement = $state()!; 
 19	
 20	 const currentYear = new Date().getFullYear();
 21	 
 22	 function introAnimations() {
 23	
 24	 // Scroll activated animations powered by anime instead of svelte transitions
 25	 const logoAnimate = maskSlideIn(logoElement, {});
 26	 const fullEmailLinkAnimate = letterSlideIn(fullEmailLinkElement, { delay: 6, initDelay: 150 });
 27	 const creditsAnimate = maskSlideIn(creditsElement, { delay: 150 });
 28	 const statusAnimate = letterSlideIn(statusElement, { delay: 6, initDelay: 100 });
 29	
 30	 // Intersection observer to run animations when footer is in scroll view
 31	 onScrolledIntoView(footerContainerElement, () => {
 32	 logoAnimate.anime();
 33	 creditsAnimate.anime();
 34	 fullEmailLinkAnimate.anime();
 35	 statusAnimate.anime();
 36	
 37	 // Signature SVG animation
 38	 let animation = [{ strokeDashoffset: '0' }];
 39	
 40	 // Signature animation using svg strokDashOffset
 41	 signaturePath1.animate(animation, {
 42	 duration: 1000,
 43	 delay: 0,
 44	 easing: 'cubic-bezier(.72,.3,.25,1)',
 45	 fill: 'forwards' 
 46	 });
 47	 signaturePath2.animate(animation, {
 48	 duration: 300,
 49	 delay: 1000,
 50	 easing: 'cubic-bezier(.47,.41,.26,1)',
 51	 fill: 'forwards' 
 52	 });
 53	 signaturePath3.animate(animation, {
 54	 duration: 200,
 55	 delay: 1300,
 56	 easing: 'cubic-bezier(.47,.41,.26,1)',
 57	 fill: 'forwards' 
 58	 });
 59	 signaturePath4.animate(animation, {
 60	 duration: 1000,
 61	 delay: 1500,
 62	 easing: 'cubic-bezier(.47,.41,.26,1)',
 63	 fill: 'forwards' 
 64	 });
 65	 });
 66	 }
 67	
 68	 onMount(async () => {
 69	 await loadPagePromise;
 70	 introAnimations();
 71	 });
 72	
 73	</script>

 1	# Jai Samyukth Portfolio
 2	
 3	A dark luxury professional portfolio website for Jai Samyukth, Co-Founder of Genrec AI.
 4	
 5	## About
 6	
 7	This portfolio showcases Jai Samyukth's work as a creator who blends luxury design, high-performance technology, and strategic execution. Co-founder of Genrec AI, building privacy-focused, high-impact AI solutions.
 8	
 9	## Features
 10	
 11	- **Dark Luxury Theme**: Deep navy background with gold and cyan accents
 12	- **Smooth Animations**: Custom letter reveals, parallax scrolling, and interactive elements
 13	- **Responsive Design**: Optimized for all devices and screen sizes
 14	- **Contact Form**: Functional contact form with server-side validation
 15	- **SEO Optimized**: Complete meta tags and Open Graph support
 16	- **Performance Focused**: Optimized assets and loading strategies
 17	
 18	## Tech Stack
 19	
 20	- **Framework**: SvelteKit
 21	- **Styling**: Sass with custom design system
 22	- **Animations**: Anime.js and custom SVG animations
 23	- **Deployment**: Vercel
 24	- **Contact**: Serverless functions for form handling
 25	
 26	## Projects Featured
 27	
 28	- **Tabble**: Ultra-luxury hotel dining tablet app
 29	- **Genrec AI**: Corporate showcase for AI solutions
 30	- **Revolvo**: AI learning platform
 31	- **Solo Level Up**: Gamified productivity app
 32	- **Where's My Bus**: Real-time government bus tracker
 33	- **SyncStream & WordCounterTool**: AI-powered utility tools
 34	
 35	## Development
 36	
 37	```bash
 38	# Install dependencies
 39	npm install
 40	
 41	# Start development server
 42	npm run dev
 43	
 44	# Build for production
 45	npm run build
 46	
 47	# Preview production build
 48	npm run preview
 49	```
 50	
 51	## License & Attribution
 52	
 53	Originally based on [Musab Hassan's portfolio](https://github.com/Musab-Hassan/musabhassan.com) (MPL 2.0 Licensed) — Modified by Jai Samyukth.
 54	
 55	This project is licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. See the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.
 56	
 57	## Contact
 58	
 59	- **Email**: placeholder@domain.com
 60	- **LinkedIn**: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/jaisamyukth/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jaisamyukth/)
 61	- **GitHub**: [https://github.com/jaisamyukth](https://github.com/jaisamyukth)
 62	
 63	---
 64	
 65	**Live Site**: [https://jaisamyukth.vercel.app](https://jaisamyukth.vercel.app)
 66

 1	<script lang="ts">
 2	
 3		import { animate } from "animejs";
 4		import { loadPagePromise } from "$lib/store";
 5		import { maskSlideIn } from "$lib/animations";
 6		import { browser } from "$app/environment";
 7	 import { scrollAnchorState } from "$lib/state.svelte";
 8		interface Props {
 9			// Scroll container to allow scrolling when anchors are clicked
 10			scrollContainer: HTMLElement;
 11		}
 12	
 13		let { scrollContainer }: Props = $props();
 14	
 15		let mobileMenuActive: boolean = $state(false);
 16		let isMobileMenuAllowed: boolean = $state(browser ? window.innerWidth <= 950 : false);
 17	
 18		let mobileTransitionSwitcher = 
 19			$derived(mobileMenuActive ? 
 20			maskSlideIn : 
 21			(node: HTMLElement, _: any) => { 
 22				let out = maskSlideIn(node, {reverse: true, duration: 3000}); 
 23				return { 
 24					tick: (t: number) => {
 25						let reversedT = 1 - t;
 26						out.tick(reversedT);
 27						// Reset animation once all animations are done so desktop nav bar doesn't break
 28						if (t == 1) setTimeout(() => out.tick(1), 500);
 29					} 
 30				}
 31			});
 32	
 33	
 34		function navigate(anchor: HTMLElement) {
 35			scrollContainer.scrollTo({
 36				top: anchor.offsetTop - (window.innerHeight / 5),
 37				behavior: "smooth"
 38			});
 39			mobileMenuActive = false;
